scenario:
Nvidia designs and sells graphics processing units (GPUs) that power gaming consoles and data centers, with a commanding 80% market share in AI data center chips. The company has increased its dividend by 16.3% annually over the past five years, with a conservative 1.11% payout ratio. Nvidia trades at a premium 31.7 times forward earnings.

ASML Holding is the only manufacturer of extreme ultraviolet (EUV) lithography machines, essential for producing advanced computer chips. The company has a monopoly in the semiconductor equipment industry, with a 35.2% payout ratio and a 23.4% annual dividend growth rate over the past five years. ASML trades at a premium 29.5 times forward earnings.

Costco Wholesale operates a membership-only warehouse club chain with a loyal customer base and a unique business model that generates predictable profit from annual membership fees. The company has increased its dividend by 12.3% annually over the past five years, with a conservative 26.4% payout ratio. Costco trades at a premium 51.8 times forward earnings.

All three companies have strong competitive advantages, conservative payout ratios, and double-digit dividend growth rates, making them attractive for investors seeking rising income streams and capital appreciation potential.
